page.title: 12The Town Centre - 2011
page.content:
As an update to the 1986 article, the 4 "Big Stores" mentioned: Woolco, Presto, Fine Fare and John Menzies are all but distant memories. The Centre continues to be fully undercover but was heavily expanded in the late 1990s and again in 2008. The 3 main stores now are the ASDA Wal*Mart Supercentre, Marks & Spencer and Debenhams. The centre continues to be a major employer in the town and has been complimented by further retail developments such as the Livingston Designer Outlet, as well as a number of retail parks with large stores including Curry's and PC World, JJB Sports, REID Furniture, PoundStretcher, Matalan, B&Q, Sainsbury's and Toys "R" Us.

The Bus Station was demolished in the late 1990s and buses now run on a road between The Centre and the Livingston Designer Outlet.

The Livingston Development Corporation was wound up in 1996 and the area is now managed by West Lothian
